definition: tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated

sentences.english: Out in the ocean any floating refuge can save the life of an exhausted bird.
sentences.chinese: 遼闊的大洋上任何浮物都能讓疲累得鳥兒憩息。

sentences.english: I was very tired, and soon I fell into a very deep sleep.
sentences.chinese: 我疲累不堪，很快就沉沉入睡了。

sentences.english: The world looks bleak to those who are Overtired.
sentences.chinese: 過度疲累的人看到的世界是極度的蕭索與荒涼。

sentences.english: Listen to your body. If you are working too much you will start feeling tired, cranky and apathetic.
sentences.chinese: 工作過度的你會發覺你正變得疲累，暴躁和冷淡。

sentences.english: The old horse was worn out by the long and painful journey and sank under him.
sentences.chinese: 那匹老馬因長途艱苦跋涉而疲累不堪，便倒了下去。

sentences.english: Imagine swimming in a pool or ocean and becoming very tired.
sentences.chinese: 想象您在泳池裏或是海里游泳時，漸漸變得疲累不堪。

sentences.english: Does anyone kiss you goodnite when you're tired.
sentences.chinese: 有人在你疲累的夜晚，親吻你晚安嗎？

sentences.english: Don't overstrain when you feel weak.
sentences.chinese: 不要過勞，當你覺得疲累的時候。

sentences.english: Let not the dark thee cumber.
The dog-tired boy finally succumbed to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 這疲累的男孩，最後陷入沉睡中。

sentences.english: Exasperated and exhausted, Karen zipped open the Prada wallet.
sentences.chinese: 惱怒而疲累的凱倫打開了那個Prada錢包。

sentences.english: Get sick a cup of hot water, tired when a basin of warm water.
sentences.chinese: 生病時一杯熱水，疲累時一盆溫腳水。

sentences.english: Out in the ocean, any floating refuge can save the life of can exhausted bird.
sentences.chinese: 遼闊的大洋上，任何浮物都能讓疲累的鳥兒憩息。

sentences.english: When the sun had risen further the old man realized that the fish was not tiring.
sentences.chinese: 太陽昇得更高，老人明白這條魚並沒有疲累。

definition: spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
in great spirits/to have great vitality
to collapse (from dehydration or loss of blood)/heat exhaustion
